data.title: Feature Request: Command line flag to disable files.autosave setting

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
As of version 1.2.1, if I have files.autosave set to anything other than "off", and am using VSCode as my Git editor, we run the risk of "saving" a commit message before we're actually done writing it.  VSCode currently has the -w flag, which keeps it from closing until the application is deliberately closed, but the file still auto-saves if that's how the developer normally works (they have files.autosave set to something other than "off").

It would be nice to do something like this to ensure that VSCode won't persist changes until the application is closed:

`code.exe --wait --new-window --no-auto-save`

Either that, or override specific workspace settings from the cli

`code.exe --wait --new-window --override-settings "files.autosave=off"`

data.title: Emmet: guaranteed applying new preferences
Feature request: add confirmation dialog to `Synchronize Changes` button
data.body:
'Synchronize Changes' button is located directly under file explorer and next to 'Show Errors' button so it can be clicked accidentially. Once clicked it performs git pull & push without any confirmation.

I think having such a tiny button, silently performing such a significant action, may cause troubles.

Can you add confirmation dialog for this button or/and move it somewhere?

data.title: Respect metered connections on Windows 10

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Connect to a Wifi network 
2. Set the connection type as metered (`Wifi > Advanced Settings > Turn metered connection on`) 
3. Open Resource Monitor
4. Switch to the network tab
5. Start VS Code
6. Notice VS Code updates happen normally, and there is general ongoing network usage from `code.exe` and `git-remote-https.exe`

VSCode should respect metered connections, as sometimes you may need to tether to your mobile to get some work done and it would be nice if it has 0 network usage when the connection was metered. In the very least it should not download any updates over metered connections.

data.title: Goto menu title should be "Go to"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.1-stable
- OS Version:Window 7

"Go to" better matches the menu commands in the menu group "Go to File..", etc.

Not sure how localization is handling "Goto" since it isn't a real word.

data.title: Should Goto > Switch Editor Group > Side Group be Center Group?
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

Should Goto > Switch Editor Group > Side Group be Goto > Switch Editor Group > Center Group to match OPEN EDITORS LEFT, CENTER, and RIGHT grouping?

data.title: autoClosingBrackets and bracket surround should be two features

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I'd like to use the bracket surround functionality, where you select a word and enter a bracket-like character `' " ( {` and the word becomes surrounded by these characters.  VScode does this already, but only if you have autoClosingBrackets enabled.  I find the other behaviors of autoClosingBrackets really annoying (it swallows closing bracket characters if you type one which often leads to mistakes when using a multi-cursor edit).  It would be nice if we could have finer control over these behaviors.

data.title: Regression: settings.json intellisense not working within quotes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-oss-dev 1.3.0 (1739c99c7255a22c588d9a1aaa141fdc38c90813)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-24-generic, Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open user settings
2. Try add a new setting (with quotes) using intellisense

Type `"`, no intellisense popup (it should appear here):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/16463772/1c8a4886-3dec-11e6-8e80-f9612c5b4043.png)

Type `e`, intellisense popup appears:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/16463800/388f716e-3dec-11e6-8aec-76a6d76c6ea0.png)

Type `d` to refine suggestions, popup disappears:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/16463823/5387a22a-3dec-11e6-9dbe-07e6e1f6fd4b.png)

data.title: Massive replace makes window unresponsible and then crashes the window
data.body: Testing #8184. - VSCode Version: Insiders 6/29 - OS Version: Windows Steps to Reproduce: 1. Use a large code base such as the vscode repo 2. "View: Show Search" 3. Expand Search 4. Enter `a` as search string 5. Enter `b` as replace string 6. Press Enter 7. Wait for the search to finish 8. Press Replace All Then: Eventually the window will crash. We should have safeguards against this kind of abuse. Independently, the window should never become unresponsive.

data.title: Cancel Replace All confirmation dialog while search is running resets the search progress
data.body:
Testing #8184.
- VSCode Version: Insiders 6/29
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use a large code base such as the vscode repo
2. "View: Show Search"
3. Expand Search
4. Enter `a` as search string 
5. Enter `b` as replace  string
6. Press Enter
7. While the search is still running press 'Replace All'
   -> Search progress stops
8. Press Cancel in the dialog

I'm not sure what happens at this moment, but the search progress is reset (maybe even a new search is started) and the search seems to never finish.

data.title: Replace All should be disabled while search is still running
data.body:
Testing #8184.
- VSCode Version: Insiders 6/29
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use a large code base such as the vscode repo
2. "View: Show Search"
3. Expand Search
4. Enter `a` as search string 
5. Enter `b` as replace  string
6. Press Enter
7. While the search is still running press 'Replace All'

-> What the replace all dialog shows is a snapshot.

Either Replace All should be disabled while a search is running or the dialog should show the life number of search results and should enable OK only when the search finished.

data.title: Multiple text cursors after dropping from file explorer
data.body:
Test item #7852 
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (798b41ab1cf3636a27042020a54ddfb4cfb8d23c, 2016-06-29T05:14:50.570Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.13.0-34-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open two files side-by-side.
2. Focus left editor -> shows cursor
3. Drag&drop from Ubuntu's file explorer on to the right editor area
4. -> Right editor gets focus and shows cursor, yet the cursor in the left editor is not removed. There are now two blinking cursors which is unexpected.

data.title: Search and replace boxes should place caret in same place
data.body:
Testing #8184.
- VSCode Version: Insiders 6/29
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. "View: Show Search"
2. Expand Search
3. Enter search string 
4. Enter replace  string
5. Use Up and Down Arrow keys to go back and forth between the search field and the replace field

-> The search field puts the caret at the beginning of the text. The replace field puts the caret at the end of the text. They should both behave the same, preferably setting the caret at the end of the text.

data.title: Inline all SVGs for the workbench when building
data.body:
**Note**: one issue we have is that many SVG icons contain metadata or unused CSS classes.
1. look into where SVG icons are duplicated in the CSS file and move them to one selector
2. Go through all our CSS and remove duplicate references to the same svg file
3. Go to gulpfile.common.js and add result['vs/css'] = { inlineResources: true }; at https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/build/gulpfile.common.js#L48

To fix https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7839

data.title: Search: Clean up and simplify
data.body:
Search models: Currently search models are complex and tangled. We have disk match model and live match model. One contains other and also extends other. Disk model is used when live match model is not available, when live match model is created it wraps disk model. But they are not in sync always. This makes it very complex to use and extend functionalities.

Search Viewlet: Everything is in one place, even though it is not very bad it would be good to have independent and distributed code/logic

Interactions between models and views.
- [x] https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8710
- [x] Decorations remain after removed from results by applying replace all on a file and do undo. Remain even after clearing results 
- [x] #8278

data.title: Consider another color (blue) for Extension view Enable button
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

The beige yellow Enable button does not look compelling IMO.  I can see that you wanted to contrast the green Install button (green means go) but yellow means yield and isn't attractive.

Consider using blue which is a very common button color and will have good contrast on both light and dark themes.  We generally use blue for highlighting and in this case we want to highlight that you need to take an action to enable the extension.
